description: Calculates the proportion of a customer's monthly income that goes toward debt payments.
definition: DTI = \frac{\text{Total Monthly Debt Payments}}{\text{Monthly Income}} = debincratio

description: Measures how much of available credit a customer is currently using.
definition: CUR = \frac{\text{Total Credit Used}}{\text{Total Credit Limit}} = credutil

description: Calculates the ratio of loan amount to the value of the asset securing the loan.
definition: LTV = \frac{\text{Mortgage Balance}}{\text{Property Value}} = \frac{\text{propfinancialdata.mortgagebits.mortbalance}}{\text{propfinancialdata.propvalue}}

description: Measures the total worth of a customer to the financial institution over the entire relationship.
definition: CLV = custlifeval, which factors in product usage, tenure, profitability, and expected future transactions.

description: Calculates the financial value of a customer by subtracting liabilities from assets.
definition: Net Worth = \text{Total Assets} - \text{Total Liabilities} = totassets - totliabs = networth

description: Composite score measuring overall credit wellness based on multiple factors.
definition: CHS = 0.4 × \frac{credscore}{850} + 0.2 × (1 - credutil) + 0.2 × (1 - debincratio) + 0.1 × \frac{credageyrs}{20} + 0.1 × (1 - \frac{delinqcount + latepaycount + choffs + bankr}{10}), \text{where each component is capped at 1.0}

description: Measures a customer's overall financial stability combining income, savings, and debt factors.
definition: FSI = 0.3 × (1 - debincratio) + 0.3 × \frac{liqassets}{mthincome × 6} + 0.2 × \frac{bankaccbal}{mthincome × 3} + 0.2 × \frac{savamount}{mthincome × 12}, \text{where each component is capped at 1.0}

description: Quantifies how actively a customer uses bank products and services.
definition: CES = 0.4 × produsescore + 0.3 × chanusescore + 0.2 × bankrelscore + 0.1 × \frac{custservint}{10}, \text{where each component is capped at 1.0}

description: Measures the profitability of a customer relationship adjusted for credit risk.
definition: RAR = profitscore × (1 - \frac{risklev}{4}), \text{where risklev is converted to a numeric scale: Low=1, Medium=2, High=3, Very High=4}

description: Composite measure of account quality considering age, mix, and payment history.
definition: AHI = 0.4 × \frac{avgaccage}{10} + 0.3 × accmixscore + 0.3 × payconsist, \text{where each component is capped at 1.0}

description: Identifies customers with excellent creditworthiness and financial stability.
definition: A customer with credscore > 720, defhist of 'Excellent' or 'Good', and risklev of 'Low'.

description: Identifies customers who may be financially stressed or at risk.
definition: A customer with debincratio > 0.5, liqassets < mthincome × 3, and at least one of: delinqcount > 0, latepaycount > 1, or ovrfreq of 'Frequent'.

description: Identifies customers with significant value to the institution.
definition: A customer with custlifeval in the top quartile, tenureyrs > 5, and crossratio > 0.5.

description: Identifies customers actively working to establish or improve credit.
definition: A customer with credageyrs < 3, credinq > 2 in the past year, and recentbeh of 'Improving'.

description: Identifies customers who primarily engage through digital channels.
definition: A customer with chaninvdatablock.onlineuse of 'High' or chaninvdatablock.mobileuse of 'High', and chaninvdatablock.autopay of 'Yes'.

description: Identifies customers with significant investment activity and sophistication.
definition: A customer with chaninvdatablock.invcluster.investport of 'Moderate' or 'Aggressive', chaninvdatablock.invcluster.investexp of 'Extensive', and investamt > 0.3 × totassets.

description: Identifies customers who heavily rely on revolving credit.
definition: A customer with credutil > 0.7, cardcount > 2, and cardpayhist of 'Fair' or 'Poor'.

description: Assesses risk related to a customer's property investment.
definition: A customer with propfinancialdata.propown of 'Own', LTV > 0.8, and propfinancialdata.mortgagebits.mortpayhist of 'Fair' or 'Poor'.

description: Identifies customers frequently seeking new credit.
definition: A customer with hardinq > 3 in the past six months, seekbeh of 'High', and newaccage < 1.

description: Identifies customers who are financially over-extended.
definition: A customer with DTI > 0.43, CUR > 0.8, and at least one of: ovrfreq of 'Frequent', bouncecount > 0 in the past three months.

description: Illustrates the meaning of different credit score ranges.
definition: Credit scores (credscore) typically range from 300-850. 300-579: Poor, 580-669: Fair, 670-739: Good, 740-799: Very Good, 800-850: Excellent, Otherwise: Unknown. Higher scores indicate lower credit risk.

description: Illustrates the meaning of income stability scores.
definition: Income stability (incstabscore) ranges from 0-10. Scores below 3 indicate highly variable income, 3-6 indicates moderate stability, and above 6 indicates highly stable income sources.

description: Illustrates what different debt-to-income ratios mean for lending decisions.
definition: Debt-to-Income ratio (debincratio) ranges from 0-1 (or above). Below 0.36 is typically considered excellent, 0.36-0.43 is good, 0.43-0.50 is concerning, and above 0.50 is risky for new credit approval.

description: Illustrates how credit utilization affects credit scores.
definition: Credit Utilization (credutil) ranges from 0-1 (or above). Utilization under 0.30 is optimal for credit scores, 0.30-0.50 has moderate negative impact, 0.50-0.70 has significant negative impact, and above 0.70 severely impacts credit scores.

description: Illustrates what different LTV ratios mean for mortgage lending.
definition: Loan-to-Value ratio (LTV) typically ranges from 0-1 (or above). Below 0.80 generally avoids private mortgage insurance requirements, 0.80-0.95 typically requires PMI, and above 0.95 indicates high leverage and increased lending risk.

description: Illustrates what different risk level classifications mean.
definition: Risk level (risklev) values indicate likelihood of default or financial difficulty. 'Low' indicates minimal risk, 'Medium' indicates moderate risk requiring standard monitoring, 'High' indicates significant risk requiring enhanced monitoring, and 'Very High' indicates severe risk requiring active intervention.

description: Illustrates what different payment history classifications indicate.
definition: Payment history (defhist, mortpayhist, rentpayhist, cardpayhist, loanpayhist) classifications indicate reliability. 'Excellent' indicates no late payments, 'Good' indicates minimal late payments, 'Fair' indicates occasional missed payments, 'Poor' indicates regular missed payments, 'Current' indicates being up to date, and 'Past' indicates historical data.

description: Illustrates what different cross-sell ratio values indicate.
definition: Cross-sell ratio (crossratio) ranges from 0-1. Values below 0.2 indicate minimal product relationships, 0.2-0.5 indicates moderate opportunity, and above 0.5 indicates strong existing relationship with high additional sales potential.

description: Illustrates what different account mix scores represent.
definition: Account mix score (accmixscore) ranges from 0-1. Higher scores indicate a healthy diversity of account types (revolving, installment, mortgage, etc.), which positively impacts credit scores and indicates financial sophistication.

description: Illustrates what different churn rate values indicate about customer retention risk.
definition: Churn rate (churnrate) ranges from 0-1. Values below 0.1 indicate low attrition risk, 0.1-0.2 indicates moderate risk, 0.2-0.3 indicates high risk, and above 0.3 indicates severe risk of customer loss requiring immediate relationship management intervention.

description: Extended debt ratio that accounts for all financial obligations including housing costs.
definition: TDSR = DTI + \frac{\text{Housing Costs}}{\text{Monthly Income}}, \text{where Housing Costs are determined by propfinancialdata and DTI is the Debt-to-Income Ratio}

description: Comprehensive measure of overall credit quality incorporating credit score and utilization.
definition: CQI = 0.6 × \frac{credscore}{850} + 0.4 × (1 - CUR), \text{where CUR is the Credit Utilization Ratio}

description: Measures the affordability of housing costs relative to income.
definition: HAR = \frac{\text{Monthly Housing Payment}}{\text{Monthly Income}} × 100\%, \text{where Monthly Housing Payment is derived from propfinancialdata and LTV calculations}

description: Quantifies financial fragility by combining debt burden and savings adequacy.
definition: FVS = 0.5 × DTI + 0.5 × (1 - \frac{liqassets}{mthincome × 6}), \text{where DTI is the Debt-to-Income Ratio and the second term measures emergency fund adequacy}

description: Calculates risk of customer attrition based on engagement and satisfaction metrics.
definition: CRR = 0.4 × churnrate + 0.3 × (1 - CES) + 0.3 × \frac{complainthist}{3}, \text{where CES is the Customer Engagement Score and complainthist is converted to numeric (Low=1, Medium=2, High=3)}

description: Measures the proportion of customer assets that can be quickly converted to cash.
definition: ALR = \frac{liqassets}{totassets} = \frac{liqassets}{Net Worth + totliabs}, \text{where Net Worth is the difference between assets and liabilities}

description: Advanced measure of credit risk that incorporates payment history and account diversity.
definition: CRI = 0.5 × (1 - \frac{credscore}{850}) + 0.3 × \frac{delinqcount + latepaycount + choffs}{10} + 0.2 × (1 - AHI), \text{where AHI is the Account Health Index}

description: Evaluates the quality and performance of customer's investment allocations.
definition: IPQ = 0.4 × RAR + 0.4 × \frac{investamt}{totassets} + 0.2 × \frac{chaninvdatablock.invcluster.investexp}{3}, \text{where RAR is the Risk-Adjusted Return and investexp is converted to numeric (Limited=1, Moderate=2, Extensive=3)}

description: Quantifies the depth and quality of a customer's banking relationship.
definition: BRS = 0.3 × bankrelscore + 0.3 × (1 - churnrate) + 0.4 × CES, \text{where CES is the Customer Engagement Score}

description: Measures the trajectory of a customer's credit health over time.
definition: CHM = CHS × (1 + \Delta_\text{recentbeh}), \text{where CHS is the Credit Health Score and } \Delta_\text{recentbeh} \text{ is +0.1 for 'Improving', 0 for 'Stable', and -0.1 for 'Deteriorating'}

description: Identifies customers with elevated mortgage-related risk factors.
definition: A customer with high LTV (Loan-to-Value Ratio > 0.9), negative equity risk (LTV > 1.0), or payment stress (propfinancialdata.mortgagebits.mortpayhist of 'Fair' or 'Poor').

description: Identifies customers with problematic credit utilization patterns.
definition: A customer with CUR (Credit Utilization Ratio) > 0.8, an increasing trend in utilization, and limited available credit (totcredlimit < mthincome × 2).

description: Identifies customers showing multiple signs of financial difficulty.
definition: A customer with FVS (Financial Vulnerability Score) > 0.7, recent payment issues (delinqcount > 0 or latepaycount > 0 in past six months), and negative Net Worth.

description: Identifies customers who are good candidates for premium banking services.
definition: A customer with high CQI (Credit Quality Index > 0.8), strong FSI (Financial Stability Index > 0.7), and significant assets (totassets > $250,000).

description: Identifies customers who would benefit from increased digital engagement.
definition: A customer with low digital engagement (chaninvdatablock.onlineuse not 'High' and chaninvdatablock.mobileuse not 'High') but high BRS (Banking Relationship Strength > 0.7) and multiple products (produsescore > 0.5).

description: Identifies customers who would benefit from credit-building products.
definition: A customer with limited credit history (credageyrs < 2), low CQI (Credit Quality Index < 0.6), but positive banking behavior (bouncecount = 0 and bankrelscore > 0.6).

description: Identifies customers who are good candidates for investment services.
definition: A customer with high ALR (Asset Liquidity Ratio > 0.3) and strong income (mthincome > $5,000).

description: Identifies customers with deteriorating credit health requiring intervention.
definition: A customer with negative CHM (Credit Health Momentum < 0), increasing CRI (Credit Risk Intensity growing by >10% in 6 months), and rising DTI (Debt-to-Income Ratio increasing by >5% in 6 months).

description: Identifies customers at high risk of ending their banking relationship.
definition: A customer with high CRR (Customer Retention Risk > 0.7), declining product usage (decreasing produsescore), and competitive shopping behavior (hardinq > 2 in past 3 months).

description: Identifies customers who should be prioritized for cross-selling efforts.
definition: A customer with strong CES (Customer Engagement Score > 0.7), positive CQI (Credit Quality Index > 0.7), and unrealized product potential (crossratio > 0.5 but produsescore < 0.5).

description: Defines customers with a high level of engagement with bank products and services.
definition: A Customer Engagement Score (CES) greater than 0.7.

description: Quarter of the year when the customer started with the institution.
definition: Quarter of the year when the customer started with the institution (scoring date minus tenure years)
